title: Former Australia wing Ian Williams on switching allegiances to Japan: 'I experienced what professional rugby was like years before it happened'
text:
More than 25 years after winning his only cap for the Brave Blossoms, in the process becoming the first player from a major Test nation to wear the cherry and white, Ian Williams is still big in Japan. When the Japanese made a big song and dance of announcing the venues for this World Cup two years ago, the former Wallaby wing and Shane Williams were the two rugby superstars chosen to host the announcement.
